explanation:
The correct calculation for cell \(\bigstar\) is \(20 \times 5 = 100\). 
The student computed \(20 + 5 = 25\) instead. 
The error stems from treating the grid cell as requiring addition of the row and column headers rather than their product. 
This reflects a fundamental confusion between additive and multiplicative relationships in grid multiplication, where each cell must represent partial products of the partitioned factors. 
The error is distinct from writing digits side-by-side (which would yield \(205\) or \(25\) from \(2\) and \(5\)) or misapplying distribution (which would involve incorrect splitting of terms). 
The direct substitution of addition for multiplication aligns exclusively with the core arithmetic operation confusion.
